name: The Old Palace Lodge Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to attend a friend's Birthday bash and having read previous reviews about this hotel, decided it was worth booking a double room.
reviews.title: Excellent and well worth the visit

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and welcoming with plenty of car parking space albeit that it was a bit of plod from the car park at the rear to the hotel lobby. Not good if it is raining!
reviews.title: Excelland Standard Excellent Staff

reviews.text: There was a company Christmas 'do' on that night and we thought that we might be disturbed by the noise but the room we had (a recently refurbished one) was quiet and spacious and very clean indeed. The bed was comfortable as were the pillows. We found the staff polite and attentive. Breakfast next morning was 1st class.
reviews.title: Great old fashioned service - they definitely put the customer first!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid £10 extra for the refurbished room which meant the total bill was a little higher than the 'norm' but well worth it in my opinion.
reviews.title: Enjoyed every minute

reviews.text: We also received a complimentary Sunday newspaper of our choice that, although not unusual, I still thought was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great staff and loads of character

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 Saturday night for my friends wedding, we got in on the Earlybird by booking 21 days+ in advance.
reviews.title: Great nights sleep, 24hr bar and good breaky!

reviews.text: We did not arrive at the hotel until 2.30am, and nothing was too much trouble. We managed to check in with no problems, went back down to the bar and had drinks put on our rooms and we were able to order a mixed platter of sarnies from a night menu!!
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem in Dunstable!

reviews.text: I would compare the rooms of that of Hilton hotels, nice and roomy, big LCD tv, kettle, loads of hot drinks available in the room. Massive bathroom with all the usual complimentary toiletries.
reviews.title: quaint place to stay for a mini holiday
A jewel in the heart of Dunstable
reviews.text: The rooms were impecably clean and all the glass in the bathrooms were clean, with no water stains on them.
Would defo use again if I needed to, and a great base close to the high street and for any weddings in the vacinity.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: This doesn't look much from the outside but when you get in it's a world away from what is outside. Superking size bed, very large room with desk, arm chair, flat screen TV and dvd player. the only downside is that the shower is not a power shower. The food was excellent and the staff were really friendly.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Would visit again.
reviews.title: Could not have been more perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a small function in one of their private rooms with beautiful dark wooden beams. We had all three courses the food was out of this world and the service was amazing too! We could not fault the experience one bit! The hotel is really lovely and the service was great with all staff very happy and helpful. The room was fab and the bed was huge! A big well done to all who helped! We will definatly be back again and SOON!!!
reviews.title: Enjoyed the day.Great Staff.

reviews.text: We stayed at The Old Palalce Lodge Hotel on the 18 02 11 for the wedding of our daughter .The pre-wedding arrangements were impeccable .Paul Thomas the hotel manager was very helpful and the rest of the staff exceptional .We had the marriage,wedding breakfast,and evening disco all at the hotel . Kylie who had the responsibility to see that the wedding arrangements went without a hitch was wonderful full marks to her .The rooms were very comfortable and clean and have tea and coffee making facilities , bath robes , hair dryer , flat screen telivisions . The morning breakfast provided a good choice of cereals , fruit , toast and full English .There is a large car park and the hotel provides a service to Luton Airport . All in all this hotel is very good value and deserves its three star AA rating .
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really friendly hotel with great staff, very comfortable rooms and a fantastic atmosphere all at a very affordable price.
reviews.title: lovely stay in the old palace

reviews.text: Stayed for one night on a work trip
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.text: Not over impressed with the town but the hotel was located near the centre and within reach of shops, pubs, food outlets and cash points
reviews.title: You can't go wrong booking here!

reviews.text: There was ample parking at the rear and side of the building
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Check-in was easy. My room was on the second floor but despite the hotel being quiet small it does have a lift
reviews.title: Comfortable place to stay

reviews.text: My room was large and clean with two single beds fastened together
reviews.title: A hidden gem, fantastic food,service and great staff

description: The Old Palace Lodge Hotel is a newly awarded 4 star hotel located in the historic Market Town of Dunstable.With 68 en-suite spacious bedrooms, designed to a standard or executive level, and three meeting and events suites, offering the perfect for business seminars and private functions, the hotel has been described as a jewel in Dunstable and it really is....The popular Henry Restaurant has welcomed Andrew Hill as the new Executive Head Chef. Andrew and his brigade have comprised a set of exciting brand new menus, from the A La Carte, Wedding, Banqueting to the room and lounge. Children and non residents are welcome.The Old Palace Lodge offers complimentary on-site car parking, Fully equipped on-site gym and complimentary WI-FI internet access. Ideally located, The Old Palace Lodge is in walking distance to Dunstable Town and situated only 10 minutes drive from the hustle and bustle of the nearby Town of Luton and Luton Airport. The M1 junction 11 is located 5 minutes away.
